headline: Salesforce Expands Into Defense And Wildfire AI With Undervalued Shares
summary: Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) secured a US$5.6b, 10 year U.S. Army technology modernization contract. The deal runs through Salesforce subsidiaries Computable Insights and Missionforce National Security. Salesforce also launched EMBERPOINT LLC, a wildfire management venture using AI and advanced technologies. EMBERPOINT involves partners including Lockheed Martin and PG&E to support wildfire detection and response. For you as an investor, this is Salesforce stepping well beyond its core CRM and...

headline: Lockheed Martin Weighs GPS Launches Wildfire Venture And Strong Share Gains
summary: Lockheed Martin (NYSE:LMT) launched the ninth GPS III satellite, GPS III SV09, expanding the modernized GPS constellation for military and civilian users. The company secured several new defense contracts tied to aviation and naval programs, adding fresh backlog tied to core defense platforms. Lockheed Martin joined forces with PG&E, Salesforce, and Wells Fargo to form EMBERPOINT, a wildfire technology venture focused on prevention and response using autonomous and AI-enabled systems. For...

headline: This Week In E-Commerce - Swiss B2C Market Grows Steadily Spurs Business Opportunities
summary: The Swiss B2C ecommerce market presents notable growth prospects across sectors like retail, travel, and technology, driven by diverse payment methods and favorable consumer demographics. According to a recent report by Research and Markets, the market is expected to grow by 6.3% annually, reaching US$23.62 billion by 2025, with an upward trend projected to continue, culminating in a market size of approximately US$29.25 billion by 2029. The study provides an extensive analysis of ecommerce...

headline: Salesforce Stock Loses Ground After $5.6 Billion Army Contract
summary: Salesforce Inc (NYSE:CRM) shares have slipped into the red after giving up earlier gains. The company had announced a major government contract win. Salesforce revealed that the U.S. Army has awarded the company a massive $5.6 billion, 10‑year Indefinite Delivery Indefinite Quantity (IDIQ) contract. The deal will be carried out through Computable Insights LLC, a wholly owned Salesforce subsidiary focusing on national security work. Under the agreement, the Army and Department of War will use Sal

headline: ServiceNow Stock Tumbles After Strong Earnings. Here’s Why.

headline: US software stocks slide after SAP, ServiceNow results fuel AI disruption fears
summary: U.S. software stocks fell on Thursday after SAP's cautious cloud outlook and a post-earnings drop in ServiceNow ​shares reinforced investor concerns about mounting competition from artificial intelligence-related ‌companies.  ServiceNow dropped 9.6% despite forecasting annual subscription revenue above Wall Street estimates.  The double-whammy dragged Salesforce shares down 5.6%, while Photoshop maker Adobe and ‍cloud security firm Datadog fell 3.1% each.

content.title: US software stocks slide after SAP, ServiceNow results fuel AI disruption fears
content.summary: U.S. software stocks fell on Thursday after SAP's cautious cloud outlook and a post-earnings drop in ServiceNow ​shares reinforced investor concerns about mounting competition from artificial intelligence-related ‌companies.  ServiceNow dropped 9.6% despite forecasting annual subscription revenue above Wall Street estimates.  The double-whammy dragged Salesforce shares down 5.6%, while Photoshop maker Adobe and ‍cloud security firm Datadog fell 3.1% each.

headline: ServiceNow Earnings Beat Estimates. Why the Software Stock Is Tumbling.
summary: ServiceNow  can’t catch a break.  The software company’s earnings report beat expectations but investors are shunning the sector and still look wary of its acquisition strategy, sending shares lower early Thursday.  ServiceNow delivered better-than-expected quarterly results and an upbeat outlook in its earnings after the market close on Wednesday.

content.title: ServiceNow Earnings Beat Estimates. Why the Software Stock Is Tumbling.
content.summary: ServiceNow  can’t catch a break.  The software company’s earnings report beat expectations but investors are shunning the sector and still look wary of its acquisition strategy, sending shares lower early Thursday.  ServiceNow delivered better-than-expected quarterly results and an upbeat outlook in its earnings after the market close on Wednesday.

headline: Wall Street Souring on Software
summary: ServiceNow, which reported earnings Wednesday afternoon, is down 11%.  The drop comes amid ServiceNow's recent streak of acquisitions, which have caused some concerns over whether the company's organic growth is slowing.  Cloud-software provider Salesforce was recently down about 8%—on pace for the largest percent decrease in nearly two years, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

content.title: Wall Street Souring on Software
content.summary: ServiceNow, which reported earnings Wednesday afternoon, is down 11%.  The drop comes amid ServiceNow's recent streak of acquisitions, which have caused some concerns over whether the company's organic growth is slowing.  Cloud-software provider Salesforce was recently down about 8%—on pace for the largest percent decrease in nearly two years, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

headline: The Nasdaq Drops 2.5%. Microsoft Sparked Another Software Selloff.
summary: Software stocks sent the Nasdaq Composite tumbling on Thursday. The tech-heavy index dropped 2.5%. The S&P 500 was down 1.5%, even though a majority of stocks in the index were positive. The Dow fell 340 points, or 0.

content.summary: Software stocks sent the Nasdaq Composite tumbling on Thursday. The tech-heavy index dropped 2.5%. The S&P 500 was down 1.5%, even though a majority of stocks in the index were positive. The Dow fell 340 points, or 0.

headline: US software stocks slump as AI disruption fears take over
summary: U.S. software stocks fell on Thursday after SAP's underwhelming cloud outlook and a post-earnings slide in ServiceNow deepened concerns that traditional ​providers are being outpaced by artificial-intelligence players. Germany's SAP plunged more than 16% as analysts ‌flagged that its cloud backlog and 2026 revenue forecast fell short of projections. ServiceNow dropped 11% despite forecasting annual ‌subscription revenue above Wall Street estimates.

content.title: US software stocks slump as AI disruption fears take over
content.summary: U.S. software stocks fell on Thursday after SAP's underwhelming cloud outlook and a post-earnings slide in ServiceNow deepened concerns that traditional ​providers are being outpaced by artificial-intelligence players. Germany's SAP plunged more than 16% as analysts ‌flagged that its cloud backlog and 2026 revenue forecast fell short of projections. ServiceNow dropped 11% despite forecasting annual ‌subscription revenue above Wall Street estimates.

headline: Wall Street Sours on Software
summary: The rout underscores how fast Wall Street’s enthusiasm for the sector has evaporated in the months since the emergence of “vibe coding”—the practice of using AI tools to quickly produce apps and websites.  ServiceNow, which reported earnings Wednesday afternoon, is down 11%.  ServiceNow's recent streak of acquisitions have caused some concerns over whether the company's organic growth is slowing.

content.title: Wall Street Sours on Software
content.summary: The rout underscores how fast Wall Street’s enthusiasm for the sector has evaporated in the months since the emergence of “vibe coding”—the practice of using AI tools to quickly produce apps and websites.  ServiceNow, which reported earnings Wednesday afternoon, is down 11%.  ServiceNow's recent streak of acquisitions have caused some concerns over whether the company's organic growth is slowing.

headline: 1 Mega-Cap Stock on Our Buy List and 2 That Underwhelm
summary: Megacap stocks are behemoths that set the tone for their industries, and their massive scale typically leads to wide moats. However, the downside is that most have already exploited their existing market opportunities and must invest heavily to expand further, a risky proposition.

content.title: 1 Mega-Cap Stock on Our Buy List and 2 That Underwhelm

headline: Stocks Slip as Gold, Silver Hit New Records
summary: STOCKS  Disappointing earnings from Microsoft fed into a tech selloff Thursday, pushing the Nasdaq composite down more than 1%. Investors recoiled after Microsoft reported higher-than-expected spending on AI infrastructure and slower cloud growth, putting its stock on course for the worst pullback since early 2020.

content.title: Stocks Slip as Gold, Silver Hit New Records

Investors recoiled after Microsoft reported higher-than-expected spending on AI infrastructure and slower cloud growth, putting its stock on course for the worst pullback since early 2020.

headline: Why Salesforce (CRM) Shares Are Plunging Today
summary: Shares of CRM software giant Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) fell 7.2% in the afternoon session after negative sentiment spread across the software sector as peers including Microsoft (MSFT), SAP (SAP), and ServiceNow (NOW) provided mixed updates.

content.title: Why Salesforce (CRM) Shares Are Plunging Today
content.summary: Shares of CRM software giant Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) fell 7.2% in the afternoon session after negative sentiment spread across the software sector as peers including Microsoft (MSFT), SAP (SAP), and ServiceNow (NOW) provided mixed updates.
